item.title: Zorro in the Court of England
item.description: Zorro in the Court of England is a 1969 Italian adventure film directed by Franco Montemurro.

item.title: Pecos Cleans Up
item.description: Pecos è qui: prega e muori is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Maurizio Lucidi.

item.title: Degueyo
item.description: Degueyo is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuseppe Vari.

item.title: Fury of Johnny Kid
item.description: Fury of Johnny Kid is a 1967 Italian-Spanish film directed by Gianni Puccini. The Italian and Spanish versions of the film have different ending. The film is a spaghetti western version of William Shakespeare's tragedy Romeo and Juliet.

item.title: Shango
item.description: Shango is a 1970 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Edoardo Mulargia and starring Anthony Steffen.

item.title: The Forgotten Pistolero
item.description: The Forgotten Pistolero is a 1969 Italian Spaghetti Western film co-written and directed by Ferdinando Baldi. The film is a western adaptation of the Greek myth of Orestes, subject of three famous drama-plays by Aeschylus, Sophocles and Euripides. Ulrich P. Bruckner puts it among the "most interesting and most touching Spaghetti Westerns of the late sixties".

item.title: Renegade Riders
item.description: Sette winchester per un massacro is a 1967 Italian spaghetti western film. It represents the official film debut for director Enzo G. Castellari, after his uncredited co-direction of Few Dollars for Django. The film stars Edd Byrnes in his first "spaghetti western" alongside Guy Madison.

item.title: Django Kill
item.description: Django Kill... If You Live, Shoot! is a film directed by Giulio Questi.

item.title: John the Bastard
item.description: John the Bastard is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Armando Crispino and starring John Richardson.

item.title: Between God
item.description: Between God, the Devil and a Winchester is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Marino Girolami.
